授業目的: This course stresses Japan's financial system with a particular reference to corporate finance. The course will review the features of Japan's financial system, financial institutions, and financial markets to ensure effective financial intermediation as well as robustness in the financial system. Also, the course will highlight the functions of the Tokyo Stock Exchange, Bank of Japan, Financial Services Agency, and the banking system for the efficient deployment of funds to entrepreneurs. Finally, the course will shed light on the determination of interest rates, time value of money and Japan's foreign exchange transactions
到達目標: After completing the course, students will learn the features of Japanese financial system, financial institutions, financial markets, and financial instruments in providing finance to corporations. The course is useful for the advanced electives in corporate finance and financial management courses, in particular.
関連科目: Introductory courses on accounting, finance, and economics
授業方法: This course will be offered on a face-to-face format. Course pedagogy includes lectures, articles, and case studies to illustrate and reinforce concepts. Students are expected to have read assigned materials before attending each class. The instructor will supply all the reading materials in advance. Please note that if the Covid situation worsens again and any international students are unable to enter the country (or unable to leave their home country), the instructor will offer a hybrid online class. Before the first class , the instructor will send students the lecture power points and reading materials.
